intro: Miconia freyreissii, commonly known as the Brazilian star tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It produces berries that are typically red or orange when mature, containing several seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
